title: Job 37:1
text: AT this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of his place.

title: Job 37:2
text: Hear attentively the noise of his voice, and the sound that goeth out of his mouth.

title: Job 37:3
text: He directeth it under the whole heaven, and his lightning unto the ends of the earth.

title: Job 37:4
text: After it a voice roareth: he thundereth with the voice of his excellency; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard.

title: Job 37:5
text: God thundereth marvellously with his voice; great things doeth he, which we cannot comprehend.

title: Job 37:6
text: For he saith to the snow, Be thou on the earth; likewise to the small rain, and to the great rain of his strength.

title: Job 37:7
text: He sealeth up the hand of every man; that all men may know his work.

title: Job 37:8
text: Then the beasts go into dens, and remain in their places.

title: Job 37:9
text: Out of the south cometh the whirlwind: and cold out of the north.

title: Job 37:10
text: By the breath of God frost is given: and the breadth of the waters is straitened.

title: Job 37:11
text: Also by watering he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth his bright cloud:

title: Job 37:12
text: And it is turned round about by his counsels: that they may do whatsoever he commandeth them upon the face of the world in the earth.

title: Job 37:13
text: He causeth it to come, whether for correction, or for his land, or for mercy.

title: Job 37:14
text: Hearken unto this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.

title: Job 37:15
text: Dost thou know when God disposed them, and caused the light of his cloud to shine?

title: Job 37:16
text: Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him which is perfect in knowledge?

title: Job 37:17
text: How thy garments are warm, when he quieteth the earth by the south wind?

title: Job 37:18
text: Hast thou with him spread out the sky, which is strong, and as a molten looking glass?

title: Job 37:19
text: Teach us what we shall say unto him; for we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness.

title: Job 37:20
text: Shall it be told him that I speak?  if a man speak, surely he shall be swallowed up.

title: Job 37:21
text: And now men see not the bright light which is in the clouds: but the wind passeth, and cleanseth them.

title: Job 37:22
text: Fair weather cometh out of the north: with God is terrible majesty.

title: Job 37:23
text: Touching the Almighty, we cannot find him out: he is excellent in power, and in judgment, and in plenty of justice: he will not afflict.

title: Job 37:24
text: Men do therefore fear him: he respecteth not any that are wise of heart.
